item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 4, 2025 at 4:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. El Salvador abandons Bitcoin as legal tender after failed experiment (528 points | 353 comments)
2. The Video Game History Foundation Library Opens in Early Access (88 points | 15 comments)
3. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (February 2025) (379 points | 357 comments)
4. Httptap: View HTTP/HTTPS requests made by any Linux program (406 points | 100 comments)
5. Open Euro LLM: Open LLMs for Transparent AI in Europe (109 points | 39 comments)
6. Order Declassifying JFK and MLK Assassination Records [pdf] (162 points | 120 comments)
7. Implementing a linear collider facility at CERN (9 points | discuss)
8. AMD: Microcode Signature Verification Vulnerability (192 points | 81 comments)
9. The young, inexperienced engineers aiding DOGE (1105 points | 1666 comments)
10. Macintosh Allegro Common Lisp (36 points | 7 comments)
11. AI systems with 'unacceptable risk' are now banned in the EU (175 points | 155 comments)
12. I bought a container full of Chinese electric excavators. Here's what showed up (19 points | 5 comments)
13. He went to jail for stealing someone's identity, but it was his all along (183 points | 175 comments)
14. I Wrote a WebAssembly VM in C (250 points | 55 comments)
15. Show HN: I convert videos to printed flipbooks for living (366 points | 87 comments)
16. Developer Philosophy (191 points | 48 comments)
17. The Cantonese Scrolls (粵卷) – A Cantonese Language Learning Mental RPG (89 points | 36 comments)
18. ArXiv LaTeX Cleaner: Clean the LaTeX code of your paper to submit to ArXiv (11 points | discuss)
19. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (February 2025) (124 points | 281 comments)
20. Cosmologists Try a New Way to Measure the Shape of the Universe (4 points | discuss)
21. Detroit’s revival takes shape after decades of decay (118 points | 132 comments)
22. First place in Tetris 99 using computer vision, classical AI, a lot of free time (49 points | 34 comments)
23. Auto-AVSR: Audio-Visual Speech Recognition with Automatic Labels (27 points | 1 comment)
24. Anything threatening to be a subculture is commodified before it can walk (2014) (183 points | 199 comments)
25. How Translation Works, Book Title Edition (47 points | 13 comments)
26. Efficient Reasoning with Hidden Thinking (139 points | 35 comments)
27. No-Panic Rust: A Nice Technique for Systems Programming (94 points | 62 comments)
28. Hightouch (YC S19) Is Hiring a Distributed Systems Engineer ( | hide)
29. Decorator JITs: Python as a DSL (145 points | 34 comments)
30. Mailspring: Cross-platform, fast, open source mail client (42 points | 20 comments)
